rComments: Adam teaches a very well organized class. I found his lectures to be pretty interesting if not a little too simplified. He had clicker questions in class every day based on the readings so you kinda have to read and attend class. Online sections were helpful, tests were slightly tough but nothing more than I expected. Adam is a solid professor!

I genuinely enjoyed this class. Midterm and final were not hard if you actually understood the material and how it could be applied. I found that the online section prepared me well for both tests, Emily the TA was amazing. The key to doing well is READ the articles, consistently review your notes, participate in section. STUDY lecture slides!!!

Adam was an engaging, interesting professor. He delivers the information not too fast or too slow. You'll have quizzes every class from assigned readings.  The class is not hard to follow but the tests are graded incredibly hard.  I thought I got a 100 on the first and got a low B.  I thought I got an A on the second and got a low C.

I really loved the content of this class, and Adam is an engaging lecturer, but his tests are ridiculously hard. I never missed a class and I studied hard for both tests and went in feeling as prepared as I could, but still got D's on both exams. Managed to pass the class but I definitely would not take a class with Adam again.

Adam is an engaging lecturer and makes you laugh. Iclicker quizzes for attendance in lecture are directly based off of online readings. His midterms and final are tricky--he grades for specific details in the short answer sections, and it's frustrating that he doesn't provide any sort of study guide with so much information covered.

In terms of required courses for ENVS, this was the least interesting to me, but Adam did a great job of thoroughly explaining the concepts and materials. The key to passing this class is to read and fully understand the readings he assigns. They relate DIRECTLY to lectures and he quizzes you on them every day. Overall, I enjoyed taking his class.

He takes attendance almost every class with the i-clicker so be there! Tests are really easy if you pay attention during lecture and review the slides. No trick questions. He assigns articles to read online instead of requesting you buy a textbook. Really funny and thorough!
very passionate about what he teaches, adam uses jokes and funny demonstrations to help teach the material

Adam is a great teacher. Funny guy. There is reading ever week, but it is short and decently interesting. iclicker quizzes every lecture, so be sure to go. The quizzes are easy if you have done the reading. Sections are not mandatory, but if you do not go then you have to participate weekly in an online forum.

Instead of using a textbook, you just have to read many online articles every week. Then he tests you on these articles every lecture with the iClicker, which is also how he takes attendance. I have to say that this class was really interesting but the midterms and finals are pretty tricky.

love adam! super passionate about teaching and the environment and really wants to make sure his students feel the same way. just do the homework and study for the tests and you'll be fine! was  a great class!
Took it as a senior exit requirement. Wish I would have gone to his office hours more as he was helpful. Be prepared to do a lot of writing for this class. Good mentor and good class overall

Funny and friendly British man! Very knowledgeable in his field and clearly eager to teach. No textbook (which was awesome) just articles which were typically quite simple and very interesting at times. Took it as a major requirement, so I was very interested in the subject. It has GE credit though too and I would definitely recommend the class!!

Class taken as a major requirement. He has a lively personality with a humorous touch of racism. Attendance is taken with iClickers. No textbook was required, which I loved. Instead, he assigns articles. The readings are pretty interesting but his lectures can be a bore.
